Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Rachel Ain, Sutton Place Synagogue, 225 East 51st Street, New York, N.Y. 10022.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Garodnick.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Rachel  Ain, Sutton Place Synagogue, 225 East 51st Street, New York, N.Y. 10022.

Council Member Garodnick moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 6, 2016 be adopted as printed by Council Member Deutsch.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Deutsch moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 6, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 365 Park Avenue South, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 5, Application No. 20175151 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 365 Park Ave S, Manhattan (20175151 TCM)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Unified Court System to require the Integrated Domestic Violence Courts in New York City to issue regular reports on batterer intervention programs.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Require the Integrated Domestic Violence Courts in NYC to issue regular reports on batterer intervention programs.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for construction site safety violations that result in or are accompanied by death or serious physical injury
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Penalties for construction site safety violations that result in or are accompanied by death or serious physical injury.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature, and the Governor, to enact legislation to require New York City and State employees to forfeit their pensions when they are found to have violated the law and deemed ineligible for employment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Require NYC & State employees to forfeit their pensions when they are found to have violated the law and deemed ineligible for employment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulating the use of conducted electrical weapons by the New York city police department
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Regulating the use of conducted electrical weapons by the NYPD.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Crane wind restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring information on sidewalk sheds
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring information on sidewalk sheds.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring cranes to be equipped with global positioning systems or similar locating devices
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Requiring cranes to be equipped with global positioning systems or similar locating devices.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring the city to prepare a plan to prevent sewer system backups.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation to make publicly available on their website the air pollutant emissions and fuel use data that facilities with Title V Permits are required to submit annually
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: State Dept of Environmental Conservation to make publicly available on their website the air pollutant emissions and fuel use data that facilities with Title V Permits are required to submit annually.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning companies that charge a fee for “student debt relief” already provided by the federal government and creating a private cause of action for borrowers who fall victim to these scams
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Banning companies that charge a fee for “student debt relief” already provided by the federal government.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Age limitations on school buses and replacing such school buses with all electric school buses.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Defining the term reside in the lead law.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Requiring pre-shift safety meetings for workers at construction sites.

Items.Title: Application No. 20175151 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 26th Street Hospitality Group LLC,, d/b/a Bread & Tulips, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 365 Park Avenue S, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 5, Council District 2. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, BREAD & TULIPS, 365 Park Ave S, Manhattan (20175151 TCM)

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 46 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

There is one vacant seat in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the Special Election scheduled to be held on February 14, 2017 in the 9th Council District.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, February 1, 2017.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application No. 20175151 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 26th Street Hospitality Group LLC,, d/b/a Bread & Tulips, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 365 Park Avenue S, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 5, Council District 2. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, BREAD & TULIPS, 365 Park Ave S, Manhattan (20175151 TCM)

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
